{{Spanish name|[[García (surname)|García]]|[[Serrano (surname)|Serrano]]}} {{Infobox football biography | name = Aleix García | image = Aleix Garcia Serrano SBS Cup 2015.jpg | image_size = | caption = García with [[Spain national under-18 football team|Spain U18]] in 2015 | fullname = Aleix García Serrano{{cite web |url=https://www.premierleague.com/news/612828 |title=Updated squads for 2017/18 Premier League confirmed |publisher=Premier League |date=2 February 2018 |accessdate=12 February 2018}} | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1997|6|28|df=y}} | birth_place = [[Ulldecona]], Spain | height = 1.73 m | position = [[Midfielder#Central midfielder|Central midfielder]] | currentclub = [[Girona FC|Girona]]
(on loan from [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]]) | clubnumber = 23 | youthyears1 = 2002–2005 | youthclubs1 = Ulldecona | youthyears2 = 2005–2015 | youthclubs2 = [[Villarreal CF|Villarreal]] | youthyears3 = 2015–2016 | youthclubs3 = [[Manchester City F.C. Reserves and Academy|Manchester City]] | years1 = 2014–2015 | clubs1 = [[Villarreal CF B|Villarreal B]] | caps1 = 10 | goals1 = 0 | years2 = 2014–2015 | clubs2 = [[Villarreal CF C|Villarreal C]] | caps2 = 27 | goals2 = 4 | years3 = 2015 | clubs3 = [[Villarreal CF|Villarreal]] | caps3 = 1 | goals3 = 0 | years4 = 2015– | clubs4 = [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] | caps4 = 4 | goals4 = 0 | years5 = 2017– | clubs5 = → [[Girona FC|Girona]] (loan) | caps5 = 39 | goals5 = 3 | nationalyears1 = 2013 | nationalteam1 = [[Spain national under-16 football team|Spain U16]] | nationalcaps1 = 2 | nationalgoals1 = 0 | nationalyears2 = 2013–2014 | nationalteam2 = [[Spain national under-17 football team|Spain U17]] | nationalcaps2 = 9 | nationalgoals2 = 1 | nationalyears3 = 2015 | nationalteam3 = [[Spain national under-18 football team|Spain U18]] | nationalcaps3 = 4 | nationalgoals3 = 3 | nationalyears4 = 2016 | nationalteam4 = [[Spain national under-19 football team|Spain U19]] | nationalcaps4 = 1 | nationalgoals4 = 0 | nationalyears5 = 2018– | nationalteam5 = [[Spain national under-21 football team|Spain U21]] | nationalcaps5 = 1 | nationalgoals5 = 0 | club-update = 09:04, 1 February 2019 (UTC) | nationalteam-update = 27 March 2018 }} '''Aleix García Serrano''' ({{IPA-ca|əˈleʒ ɣəɾˈsi.ə|lang}}; {{IPA-es|aˈleʃ ɣaɾˈθi.a|lang}};{{efn|In isolation, ''García'' is pronounced {{IPA-ca|ɡəɾˈsi.ə|}}/{{IPA-es|ɡaɾˈθi.a|}}, and ''Aleix'' {{IPA-ca|əˈleʃ|}}.}} born 28 June 1997) is a Spanish professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays for [[Girona FC]] on loan from English club [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] as a [[Midfielder#Central midfielder|central midfielder]]. ==Club career== ===Villarreal=== Born in [[Ulldecona]], [[Province of Tarragona|Tarragona]], [[Catalonia]], García joined [[Villarreal CF]]'s youth setup in 2005, aged eight, after starting out at CF Ulldecona.{{cite news|url=http://www.levante-emv.com/castello/2014/07/30/trabajo-ganas-e-ilusion-hacerme/1143880.html|title=Trabajo con ganas e ilusión para hacerme con un hueco este año en el Villarreal B|trans-title=I work with eagerness and hope to fit in to Villarreal B this year|work=[[Levante-EMV]]|language=es|date=29 July 2014|accessdate=23 May 2015}} He made his senior debut with [[Villarreal CF B|the reserves]] in [[Segunda División B]] on 26 April 2014 at only 16 years of age, coming on as a late [[Substitute (association football)|substitute]] in a 1–0 away win against [[CF Badalona]].{{cite web|url=http://www.villarrealcf.es/noticias/portada-ultimas-novedades/item/5349-victoria-del-villarreal-b-en-badalona |archive-url=https://archive.is/20150902210657/http://www.villarrealcf.es/noticias/portada-ultimas-novedades/item/5349-victoria-del-villarreal-b-en-badalona |dead-url=yes |archive-date=2 September 2015 |title=¡Victoria del Villarreal B en Badalona! |trans-title=Victory of Villarreal B in Badalona! |publisher=Villarreal CF |language=es |date=26 April 2014 |accessdate=23 May 2015 }} García featured for [[Villarreal CF C|the C team]] in the [[2014–15 Segunda División B|2014–15 season]], also appearing for the B side in the same campaign. He made his first team – and [[La Liga]] – debut on 23 May 2015, replacing [[Antonio Rukavina]] in a 4–0 loss at [[Athletic Bilbao]].{{cite news|url=http://www.marca.com/eventos/marcador/futbol/2014_15/la-liga/jornada_38/ath_vil/|title=El Athletic monta la fiesta|trans-title=Athletic party mounts|work=[[Marca (newspaper)|Marca]]|language=es|date=23 May 2015|accessdate=23 May 2015}} ===Manchester City=== On 27 August 2015, García joined [[Premier League]] side [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]].{{cite web|url=http://www.espnfc.us/story/2583946/manchester-city-sign-aleix-garcia-from-villarreal|title=Aleix Garcia joins Manchester City from Villarreal|publisher=ESPN FC|first=Richard|last=Jolly|date=27 August 2015|accessdate=24 August 2016}} He was selected by then-City manager [[Manuel Pellegrini]] against [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] on 21 February 2016 in the fifth round of the [[FA Cup]].{{cite web|url=http://www.espnfc.us/english-fa-cup/story/2812117/manchester-city-give-five-young-players-debuts-at-chelsea|title=Man City give five young players debuts in FA Cup game at Chelsea|publisher=ESPN FC|date=21 February 2016|accessdate=24 August 2016}} García made his first Premier League appearance on 17 September 2016, coming on as a 75th-minute substitute in a 4–0 home win against [[A.F.C. Bournemouth|Bournemouth]].{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/37325835|title=Manchester City 4–0 Bournemouth|publisher=BBC Sport|first=Mandeep|last=Sanghera|date=17 September 2016|accessdate=18 September 2016}} On 21 September, he started in an [[EFL Cup]] match against [[Swansea City A.F.C.|Swansea City]], scoring his first goal for the club in the 2–1 away win.{{cite web|url=http://www.espnfc.com/club/manchester-city/382/blog/post/2955013/teenager-aleix-garcia-impresses-as-man-city-defeat-swansea-in-efl-cup|title=Teenager Aleix Garcia impresses as Man City defeat Swansea in EFL Cup|last=Mooney|first=David|date=21 September 2016|publisher=ESPN FC|accessdate=22 September 2016}} He next started a month later on 26 October, in another EFL Cup match, a 1–0 loss to [[Manchester United]].{{cite news|url=http://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-city-news-garcia-maffeo-12085126?|title=Guardiola praises two Man City players after EFL Cup defeat to Manchester United|work=Manchester Evening News|first=Alice|last=McKeegan|date=27 October 2016|accessdate=27 October 2016}} ====Girona loan==== On 1 August 2017, García was loaned to newly promoted [[La Liga]] club [[Girona FC]] until the end of the season.{{cite web|title=Aleix García will strengthen the midfield of Girona|url=http://www.gironafc.cat/noticia/aleix-garcia-reforcara-el-migcamp-del-girona|publisher=Girona FC|accessdate=1 August 2017|date=1 August 2017|language=ca}} ==Career statistics==
